cip.render.raytrace.light

Class Spot

  • java.lang.Object
    • cip.render.raytrace.light.ALight
      • cip.render.raytrace.light.Spot
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IDynXmlObject, INamedObject, IRtLight

    public class Spot
extends ALight
    A focused spotlight source. The spotlight source is a source located in the scene and is focused along the -Y axis.

    The spotlight source is specified as a node in an XML file as:

         <DynamicallyLoadedObject class="cip.raytrace.light.Spot"
                              name="pointLightName">
         <intensity RGBf_attributes/>
         <beta>betaDegrees</beta>
     </DynamicallyLoadedObject>
    where:
    intensity The intensity of the spotlight source as specified by the RGBf_attributes which are described in RGBf.setValue(Element, boolean)
    beta The beta angle, or angle of deviation between L and the light source axis when the intensity is half the value as when L = the light source axis. Valid values are 2 degree to 85 degree. The default is 10 degree if not specified.

    Example of XML Specification

    The following specifies blue spotlight source:

         <DynamicallyLoadedObject class="cip.raytrace.light.Spot"
                              name="spotLight">
         <intensity rgb="0,0,1"/>
         <beta>10</beta>
     </DynamicallyLoadedObject>
    Since:
    1.0

      • loadFromXml

        public void loadFromXml(@NotNull
                        @NotNull org.w3c.dom.Element xmlElement,
                        @Nullable
                        @Nullable java.util.LinkedList refObjectList)
                 throws DynXmlObjParseException
        Description copied from interface: IDynXmlObject
        Loads this object from an XML DOM Document element. The DynXmlObjLoader has parsed the element and attributes to determine that this is a dynamically loaded object, found and instantiated the class, and is now sending the node to the object so it can initialize itself based on the contents of the node.
        Specified by:
        loadFromXml in interface IDynXmlObject
        Overrides:
        loadFromXml in class ALight
        Parameters:
        xmlElement - The dynamically loaded object DOM Document element.
        refObjectList - A linked list if named objects (implementing the INamedObject interface) that have already been loaded and can be used to resolve object references.
        Throws:
        DynXmlObjParseException - Thrown if there was an error parsing the object. If this exception is thrown it should be assumed that this object was incorrectly initialized, is invalid, and should not be used in any further operations.

      • getLight

        public boolean getLight(LightInfo lightInfo,
                        RayIntersection intersection,
                        int nSample,
                        int nRandom)
        Description copied from interface: IRtLight
        Get the lighting information describing how this light illuminates the ray intersection. The light should check the ray intersection to make sure the intersection actually faces the light, and return false if the intersection cannot be illuminated by the light.
        Specified by:
        getLight in interface IRtLight
        Overrides:
        getLight in class ALight
        Parameters:
        lightInfo - (LightInfo, modified) TThe description of the illumination of the intersection by this light.
        intersection - TRayIntersection, constant) The description of the ray intersection.
        nSample - The pixel sub-sample index. This is used in distributed ray-tracing to make sure the correct sample displacement is used for samples that are distributed.
        nRandom - The jitter array index.
        Returns:
        Returns true if this light illuminates the ray intersection and the lightInfo has been filled in with lighting information, otherwise false is returned and the lightInfo is meaningless (probably unchanged).
